mc_pro_critic_reviews.summary: Hot Pursuit is a quiet triumph of tone and timing. Nearly every scene is cut at just the right point, often topped off with a fantastic kicker of dialogue.

Much of the movie’s charm comes from seeing middle-aged women in roles that usually go to middle-aged men. (Vergara is 42; Witherspoon will be 40 next March.) Hot Pursuit isn’t funnier than most male outings in the cop-witness genre – the 1988 “Midnight Run” remains the best of those – but its casting makes it fresher than many.
Despite all its flaws, it achieves its goal of making the audience laugh, even against their better judgment.
It’s genial, with appealing stars and fair giggles.
I can’t believe just how dumb Hot Pursuit is. Moreover I can’t believe just how much I laughed.

Witherspoon and Vergara are both experienced comedic actors with charisma to spare, and watching them pal around is a perfectly pleasant way to pass some time. But with material this uninspired, 87 minutes of riding shotgun is long enough.
A mixture of mild pleasures and deep disappointments.

Witherspoon’s charge, Sofía Vergara as a recalcitrant witness in need of police protection, is an adept slapstick comic likewise hamstrung by director Anne Fletcher’s sluggish pacing, which reliably stays with a scene for three beats beyond the punch line.

Hot Pursuit is about two women finding sisterly common ground despite ethnic, religious, philosophical, temperamental and/or phonetic differences. It also seems an inevitable stop on Hollywood’s perpetual recycling drive, which caters to an audience perfectly content with the creaky and familiar.

What’s spanglish for déjà vu? There’s hardly a single moment in Hot Pursuit that won’t remind you of scenes you’ve seen at the multiplex a thousand times before. (The movie’s original title was Don’t Mess With Texas, probably because Thelma & Louise Ride the Pineapple Express All the Way to Jump Street — and They’ve Got Lethal Weapons, Y’all! was just too long.)
As a delivery system for a newly minted and reasonably engaging if not always laugh-out-loud comedy team — Reese Witherspoon and Sophie Vergara — Hot Pursuit works.
One’s uptight. The other’s flamboyant. Put them together and… Well, not much happens, except the desperation Hot Pursuit brings to its attempts to wring laughs out of the contrast.
This trite road-trip comedy can be so lazy that it squanders the goodwill of a premise that ought to be self-evident.
It’s a chase film, it’s a buddy film, it’s a ridiculous, loud and often offensive romp. Witherspoon’s character is cornball and annoyingly adrenalized – what was she thinking?
Here’s proof two females can make a bickering-opposites-action-comedy that’s just as lousy and sour as any clunker starring two guys.
The trailers for the Reese Witherspoon-Sofia Vergara comedy Hot Pursuit hint at a movie that’s unfunny, insufferable and obvious. You can’t say you weren’t warned.
Cheap, short and slow, Hot Pursuit is a comedy that never lets your forget that pairing up Sofia Vergara with Reese Witherspoon should have worked better than this.

A relentlessly unfunny comedy, it wastes the talents of Reese Witherspoon and Sofia Vergara as egregiously as one could possibly imagine, resorting to lame jokes, cliches and incompetent storytelling to pass the time.

While a movie that fails to catch fire is disappointing, there is something even more dispiriting about a movie that doesn’t even bother to try, that tosses its stars a soggy book of matches and expects them to generate a spark.

Although Reese Witherspoon and Sofía Vergara do have their fleetingly amusing moments, this road-trip buddy comedy feels like it rolled off the cliché assembly line, offering wan laughs and familiar setups.

The film is essentially nothing but little and ineffectual bits of recycled shtick with no sense of freshness of invention. And the women never bond in even the most rote or superficial way that's expected in this sort of claptrap.
A few mildly tone-deaf jokes are hardly enough to sink Hot Pursuit. What does, however, is its tendency to belabor the laziest, most obvious gags beyond the point of reason.
So there’s nothing here to see, except maybe the white dress that Vergara wears in her first scene.

It's the kind of movie where the bloopers that run with the end credits are much funnier than anything that came before. That's a good rule for a comedy: if the blooper reel is funnier than the movie, you're in trouble.
There's hardly an area in which Hot Pursuit is not found lacking. The comedy is unfunny with joke after joke falling painfully flat.
Hot Pursuit is this week's "Paul Blart." Which is to say, it's ill-conceived, not funny, overbearing and not in any way worth watching.
It's all stupefyingly unfunny. Hot Pursuit is one hot mess.
The only thing that could've made Sofia Vergara's misguided contribution grislier would have been to fellate a Chiquita banana.
What really offends about Hot Pursuit is its lazy approach to comedy, and so many short cuts making bad jokes possible.
The direction is credited to somebody named Anne Fletcher, but no evidence of it survives.
It would be a lot easier to give the film a soft pass if it wasn't so aggressively lazy.

Nothing in the film remotely resembles any location between San Antonio and Dallas, the beginning and end points of its labored trajectory. For someone in Fresno or Akron, this may not be a big deal, but for those of us in these here parts, it’s a damned distraction.
The joyless and perfunctory Hot Pursuit would be a black mark on anyone’s résumé, but it’s an especially disheartening one for Witherspoon at this point in her career.
There isn’t one joke, sight gag or piece of slapstick tomfoolery that lands with any success or originality in Hot Pursuit.
This is an equal-opportunity fiasco.

Hot Pursuit gets cold quickly. That’s certainly not the fault of stars Reese Witherspoon and Sofia Vergara, who work to keep this blessedly brief action-comedy shaking and cruising to an unthrilling end. The blame lies with a dopey script, director Anne Fletcher and a lazy Hollywood assumption that female buddy flicks should be as half-assed as their male counterparts.

mc_user_reviews.text: Let's just pretend this movie never happened, and we still all love Reese. It's even lower than horrible, it destroys expectations and butchers my love for Reese Witherspoon. Hot Pursuit looks like a movie made for the Razzies. And it proves it as well. The movie is painfully unfunny, badly acted and even badly written. I thought that the jokes were overused, Sofia Vergara's Jokes were lacklustre, Witerspoon's cop character fell short of expectations and the whole movie collapsed leading to the horrible climax. The movie has absolutely no funny comedy, no good acting and the interaction between Vergara and Witherspoon's characters doesn't click, it's not funny, and people will know it. There is absolutely no reason this movie should exist. Ignore Hot Pursuit.
Cool movie. An entertaining, satisfying movie actually went above my expectations. Yes, Sofia Vergara's accent is pretty annoying, and yes, the movie has tons of flat jokes, it was watchable.
This is a fun lightweight movie -don't understand all the negative reviews.  It's not the comedy of the century, but its a pleasant way to enjoy an hour and a half.  .
Witherspoon and Vergara do have chemistry together, but a lack of decent gags means this buddy comedy vehicle is running on empty.

**** is the word to describe this film! I guarantee this film just will make you angry of how bad it is. I just can't believe some people love this film. For me this film is absolutely Terrible.It is just like  Paul Bart :Mall Cop 2,Lame ****ty movie with forced jokes and an unfunny film. This movie is so awkward and the characters are generic.The characters has little to no chemistry.The movie is just so painfully bad and needs to be forgotten. Please don't watch the movie, I guarantee you this movie suck and wish to have a refund,You have been warned! Save your money and go watch other films rather than this.

HOT PURSUIT is so bad that you simply feel sad for the talent involved. And there is talent. Reese Witherspoon in particular has proven herself time and time again. I'm sure everyone related to this pic wishes it had turned out bettter. The distributor could have saved them all the embarassment by going straight to video.

terrible writing, awful plot, mediocre acting, stupid scenes meant to be "funny", AND THAT GOD AWFUL SPANISH ACCENT. This movie isn't the " seductive comedy" of the year. In fact its the one movie you wont be in pursuit of. Goddamn 2015 is not a good year for comedy movies.

Hands down this is one of the best comedies of the year. You need to be open-minded and understand the latin jokes, and in that way you can enjoy the movie. Amazing actors on it. Sofia and Reese both did a great job.
I thought it was very funny and was watching it with several others of different ages who agreed and don't understand why it is getting such a slating.  Really enjoyable movie and would recommend.

Four ladies saw this movie and laughed their butts off.  We thoroughly enjoyed this movie!  It is fun!  So maybe some of the plot points are hard to swallow, but there are some funny running gags throughout that cracked us all up.  Reese Witherspoon is adorable as the by the book female cop trying desperately to live up to her father's reputation while overcoming an unfortunate mistake that the other cops joke about.  Sofia Vergara is exactly what you would expect as the drug lord wife who lives in luxury and insists on dragging her suitcase behind her while wearing impossibly high heels.  The two ladies butt heads at every turn, but ultimately have to count on each other to stay alive.  This movie will never win any Oscars, but for regular, non-critical movie goers, it is a fun one if all you want is to be entertained.  Go see it!  Especially you ladies.  You will get a kick out of it.
it was a very entertaining movie a like i love reese witherspoon i like all of her movie like legally blonde it was a nice movie hope to watch more movie of her THUMBS UP  ^_^
WOW!! This "movie" is awful.  Reese Witherspoon what in the world were you thinking.  Seriously Hot Pursuit is currently the worst film of 2015 so far.  F

A popcorn flick in all regards. If you're seeking mindless enjoyment, you won't be disappointed. Sure, we've seen these jokes before - but Reese Witherspoon with Sofia Vergara sporadically make them fresh. It's not a great movie, but it's a movie about women, starring women.

Let me put it this way: this movie sucked bad enough to make a Kevin James movie look Oscar-worthy. I've sat through some pretty bad movies in the past, this is in the first in a while that I've wanted a refund halfway-through.

Let's see here: Hot Pursuit. Reese Witherspoon and Sofia Vergara. Odd chemistry, bland story, Sofia's horribly offensive Spanish accent (she's Columbian). A tired clone of Thelma and Louise and The Heat. Awkward script, and not enough chuckles. But absolutely painful to watch. I still love Witherspoon, but not Hot Pursuit, one of the worst comedies since her big flub from 2010. I'm out.

Misfit pairings have been done plenty and can be fodder for folly & fun. Not this time. Reese Witherspoon is an uptight, by-the-numbers cop who's assigned to protect prime witness Sofia Vergara, a hot blooded Columbian (no stretch there). Witherspoon brings lots of spunk to her role, but the script is no help. Fans of "Modern Family" (where Vergara is so hilarious) can appreciate the writing on THAT show, because THIS movie demonstrates how good writing is vital to making her delivery work. Lack of any exciting action and an entirely predictable plot doesn't help. The movie is crammed with energy and plenty of sassy back and forth…just none of it's funny.

Comedies involving a crook and a cop being partnered together on the run and eventually becoming friends are nothing new. What sets this one apart is the fact that the leads are women. It's no secret these types of roles are almost always played by men. That's not what makes the movie so enjoyable though. That would be the sharp writing.

So is this the new standard for comedies the movie industry wants to put out? Hot Pursuit is the perfect example of what trash has been labeled as comedies lately. Its lazy, unfunny, annoying, boring, pathetic and embarrassing. Reese wants women to have better roles and she and Sophia do this? Well they just took 3 steps backward.

This was a stupid film. I felt I needed to stress 'stupid' by repetition at least three times, but I think people are smart enough to understand my emphasis on the word. What the distributors didn't realize was how the script is unfunny, the story is so dated and useless as any real money maker, and that although Sofia Vergara is still gorgeous and has some chemistry with Reese Witherspoon, it can't help any film like 'Hot Pursuit' survive.

A dismal comedy and a criminal waste of talent, Hot Pursuit regurgitates every buddy cop cliche in the book and uses the two talented leads in the most ineffective way possible. Unfunny, lazy, and not worth anyone's time.
90 minutes of wasted time. After a while, the whole plot get boring. Very disappointing performances by Vergara and Witherspoon, and very disappointing directing by Anne Fletcher.
Such a waste of effort which had so many possibilities. It's hard to mix serious with comedy. They should have left the serious and silliness out, and this would have been a much better movie.
I fail to see what is so horrible about the film. If anything, It completely surpassed my expectations. I found it lighthearted and entertaining, which is what the movie was going for.
You just got coopered!

It's not bad but it's a disappointment, I wanted to love this movie because the previews were funny, so I was hopping it was good, but then the jokes didn't work, and at times it was boring and then comes a mess. A play by the book cop Cooper (Reese Witherspoon), has to get Sofia Vergara's character to Dallas to testify against a drug lord named Cortez. Every thing goes wrong! A bunch of people in masks shoot a detective and Danielle's husband, Cooper and Danielle are framed, the police are chasing them and the bad guys. The film's trailer spoils the jokes making them less clever when you watch it on the big screen, I was just waiting for them to say the one liners from the trailer (really that's how these studios are going to market their comedies?). After almost winning an Oscar for the strongest and beautiful film "Wild" Resse Witherspoon is in this stale boring film "Hot Pursuit" I guess she wanted to come back into the comedy genre again? Her character is sort of like able, but her accent is rusty. There is chemistry between the leads, this film tries to be like the raunchy wickedly clever buddy cop flick 'The Heat' (Starring Sandra Bullock and Melissa MCcarthy). Sofia Vergara's character is annoying but really is clever. The jokes actually were funny but in the beginning they were tiresome and flat. The gags don't work and since this film is written television writers: David Feeney (New Girl) and John Quaintance this film is sort of meant for TV. I don't get how the writer of "New Girl" (which from it's reception says the show is good) wrote this script. Director Anne Flecther often gives us some funny slapstick scenes put overall her also producers of the film Witherspoon and Vergara give us Brobdingnagian mess. 2/4 stars

Wow...I can't believe that I actually watched this unfunny, annoying film. I also can't believe that these two women read the script for this thing and thought..."I should do this. It will really help my already highly successful career and it should be really fun"!

This was a rather funny, but very poorly made comedy film. I laughed in quite a few parts, but again, it was not technically well made. There was, however, at least one extremely successful use of a green screen, as I couldn't even realize it was a green screen when the scene was shown in the bloopers. Overall, this is a good time. Watch it for what it is, not for what it's not.

I'm quite surprised about the low ratings here, I definitely don't see it being that bad of a movie. Ok, of course Sofie Vergara's character was her usual self and for those who have watched her in Modern family she basically was the same, so didn't add nothing new to the mix. I'm not saying that the movie was really good or anything, but it still was watchable and had its funny moments. For example, two movies came out recently - Trainwreck and Hot Pursuit, and I actually rate them being as quite similar if you look at how funny they were, but Trainwreck had much better ratings that is why I am surprised. This is a movie to watch when you want to see something not too serious where you can just laugh a bit and relax, not expect something serious or whatever, I mean this is a typical comedy, not the best one, but still an ok one.

My pick for the worst film of 2015, the funniest thing about Hot Pursuit is that it is supposed to be a comedy. It is, to put it simply, unbearably awkward. At times it's even painful. Even Reese Witherspoon, who is a talented actress, is horrible in this movie, with an awful accent, and absolutely zero chemistry with her co-star, Sofia Vergara. I have nothing good to say about this pile. It's not even the kind of bad that you can have fun criticizing it.
I enjoyed this movie and it was hilarious but I think it has too much with the sexual content. Reece Witherspoon is such a great actor though. Some of the jokes they used were funny.
Hot Pursuit is an example of a simple yet entertaining movie. It's not one of the best comedy movies out there but it's still somewhat hilarious even up to the bloopers.
There seems to be nothing good about this film and even when you do find something good, it gets destroyed by a movie virus that turns every movie bad and rotten. Watch out for those viruses.

Why are people giving this movie bad reviews? Why? Like I don't get it. The writing, acting, directing, and editing all came together wonderfully! Plus, the laughing continued throughout, unlike some movies where they peter out toward the end. Watch this movie, it is way underrated
